intro: Tetragonia villosa, commonly known as the hairy bittercress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in fields, along roadsides, and in gardens. Its leaves are characterized by their hairy texture and oval shape, while its small, yellow flowers appear in clusters. Tetragonia villosa is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
